intro: Triumfetta guaranitica, commonly known as the Brazilian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Triumfetta guaranitica is also known for its potential medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
